reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Launching a women led indigenous community enterprise

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award Fundación RENACE - Red Nacional de Acción Ecológica (RENACE) will work with five indigenous women-led community enterprises in the Alto Beni region to generate income and employment, conserve biodiversity, improve food security and strengthen their abilit.

participating-org.narrative: Fundación Renace - Red Nacional De Acción Ecológica
The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

mailing-address.narrative: 1331 Pennsylvania Ave. NW, Suite 1200 NorthÂ Washington, DC 20004

description.narrative: U.S. assistance provides training and targeted support for Bolivian counternarcotics efforts; helps the Bolivian military in its peacekeeping and natural disaster response roles; improves healthcare quality and access; conserves biodiversity; and strengthens local governments and citizen participation. The United States will work with the Government of Bolivia (GOB), civil society, and the private sector to promote a more democratic state, healthier population, and improved environmental conservation. (Source: Congressional Budget Justification FY 2014)
Obligates the award for the Award Implementing Organization to carry out the activities set forth in Annex A of the grant agreement.
